replies.author: ekiernan

replies.bodyText: Agreed sounds good to point to what already exists and we can evaluate if we want to put onto zenodo later. I don't know how to keep bio.tools up to date, it seems to reference version 2.17.x right now, so we may want to look into that too.
replies.author: kbergin

replies.bodyText: I admit I do not really know what the bio.tools folks now ask for - it may be as easy as a PR against https://github.com/bio-tools/content/blob/master/data/picard_tools/picard_tools.biotools.json . @hmenager, @joncison, @matuskalas, can you please help us out? Sidenote - for me it is about getting all of bcbio (and a few other RNA-seq pipelines) properly mapped against bio.tools and have upstream involved who may have extra ideas/comments in case some important semantics gets lost, say, when the same tool is used for different purposes.
replies.author: smoe

replies.bodyText: Sorry I missed this one 😥 What @smoe suggest is indeed the ultimate idea, but to my understanding bio.tools isn't there yet. Please update @hansioan @hmenager
